questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft Dynamics 365 environment. You plan to configure folder-level tracking.
Which two statements are true? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

choices.B: Each user can create a maximum of 25 folders in their inbox.
choices.A: Folder-level tracking is available for mailboxes that implement delegate access.
choices.C: Folder level-tracking works with the Microsoft Dynamics 365 email router.
choices.D: You cannot change the regarding object unless you remove the email from tracked folders.

discussion.content:
Should be B and D
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-engagement/admin/configure-outlook-exchange-folder-level-tracking

Under Bullet points: 

1)You can track up to a maximum of 25 folders per user account.
2)To change the regarding for any email, move the email to a different folder such as the Inbox.
B and D should be the answer.

questions.question_text:
You need to configure Microsoft OneNote integration for an organizations Microsoft Dynamics 365 case entity.
Which two components should you enable? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

discussion.content: It's correct. May be it's a little confuse what option you have choose between B and E because the specific name of the task you should trigger to accomplish the requirement. But reading carefully the documentation and trying the steps in a trial I thinks it's correct B & D.

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft Dynamics 365 tenant. You plan to implement Microsoft Office 365 Groups.
You need to ensure that all Office 365 Group features are available.
Which three actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

choices.A: Configure a Microsoft Exchange Online mailbox for each Microsoft Dynamics 365 user.
choices.E: Configure the Microsoft SharePoint List component.
choices.B: Enable the ISV Extensions security privilege.
choices.C: Configure Yammer to work with Microsoft Dynamics 365.
choices.D: Enable server-based Microsoft SharePoint in Microsoft Dynamics 365.

questions.question_text:
Your organization has a custom entity that contains 25 records.
A specific group of users need access to the records.
You need to ensure that only specified users can access the records and that you can manage access from one place.
What should you do?

discussion.content: I vote for C. A need to set up each records, that is 25 places.

On balance, best answer is C. But it's another badly worded question; what is meant by "manage access from one place"? Not standard MS terminology. There are downsides to A, C and D
A - This "manages access from 1 place" but doesn't mention giving Security Role access to the custom entity; so the Users still won't see the records if they are just put in an Access Team
C - this seems the best answer but means managing access from 2 places: Team and Security Role (although once the SR is set up, access would be managed just from within the Team)
D - this would give access to ALL Users with that Security Role, not just the group that needs it

Why not D?
With A or C you cannot manage access from one place

Correct Answer is A.
Refer to the following MS Documentation for understanding the answer.
Link:https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-engagement/developer/use-access-teams-owner-teams-collaborate-share-information

comments.content: Access teams are defined per record, so you would need to add users to 25 access teams. No way to manage from one place

choices.D: Modify an existing security role that is common to the users. Grant the role access to the custom entity.
choices.C: Create an owner team that includes the users. Assign the team a new security role which can access only the custom entity.
choices.B: Ask the owner of the custom entity records to grant specific users read and write access to the records.
choices.A: Add the users to access teams. Grant the teams read and write access for each of the custom entity records.

choices.C: You do not need to implement a list component.
choices.B: SharePoint actions including Alert Me, Download a Copy, and Copy Shortcut are supported.
choices.D: Users can create folders in Microsoft Dynamics 365.
choices.A: You only need to sign in to Microsoft Dynamics 365 to access documents stored in SharePoint.

questions.question_text:
You plan to implement a server-based integration between Microsoft Dynamics 365 and SharePoint Online.
Which two statements are true? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
